extracted_information: The provided web content is the README file for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) Python SDK GitHub repository. It contains comprehensive information about the SDK, including its purpose, installation instructions, core concepts (Servers, Resources, Tools, Prompts, Images, Context, Authentication), details on running MCP servers (development mode, Claude Desktop integration, direct execution, Streamable HTTP, mounting to ASGI), examples, advanced usage (low-level server, writing clients), MCP primitives, server capabilities, and links to documentation and contributing guidelines. It provides code examples for various functionalities.

specifications.sdk_purpose: The official Python SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients
protocol_transports_supported: SSE (superseded by Streamable HTTP for production)

features: Use standard transports (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP)
Handle MCP protocol messages and lifecycle events
Context object for tool/resource access to MCP capabilities
Development mode with MCP Inspector (`mcp dev`)
Streamable HTTP transport (stateful and stateless modes, resumability, JSON/SSE response formats)
Low-level server implementation for full control
High-level client interface for connecting to servers
OAuth client provider for connecting to protected servers
